chief.note: Recommissioned on May 15, 1830; was not reaccredited under the new commission. Served without interruption under the two commissions.
Commissioned to Peru, but received by the Government of the Peru-Bolivian Confederation. Returned to Peru, but died at Callao on January 25, 1838, without resuming charge of the Legation.
Commissioned to the Peru-Bolivian Confederation, but received by the Government of Peru.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate.

ended.note: Recall requested by the Government of Peru on

chief.note: The Government of Peru's recall request was received on June 2, 1846. Jewett left post on July 21, 1847.

ended.note: Promoted to Envoy Extraordinary and Minister Plenipotentiary
Notified the Government of Peru that relations were suspended on

chief.note: Clay left post on or after October 27, 1860.

Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on July 15, 1861, after confirmation. The new Government of Peru was still unrecognized by the United States when Robinson left Peru on December 21, 1865.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on January 22, 1866, after confirmation.

ended.note: Presented recall on or shortly before

chief.note: Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on December 14, 1875, after confirmation.
Chilean occupation forces were still in control of Lima when Hurlbut died at post on March 27, 1882.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on December 12, 1883, after confirmation.
The new Government of Peru was still unrecognized by the United States when Loeb left post on July 26, 1962.
Not commissioned; nomination withdrawn before the Senate acted upon it.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on March 12, 1830, but died en route to post before his second commission was issued.
Took oath of office and proceeded to post, but did not present credentials; left Peru on March 24, 1883.
